Author: Live Stars
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Last week development report.  1. Broadcast quality (now only depends on user channel bandwidth, models camera and mediaserver load, tested); 2. Models can now turn microphone on and off. 3. Regional block (models can set it in the settings, before the broadcast) 4. Private video chat implemented: - tokens get transferred from user to model at a custom per-second rate. - private video chat messaging (not saved on the server) - private chat starts after model confirmation - can be stopped by both model and user 5: Streamer can be blocked by administrator + any stream can be stopped - admin can stop any stream - model cannot start streaming if admin has blocked their broadcast - admin can unban streamers  We are moving on to closed testing this week.  Exchanges - waiting on OpenLedger. Cryptopia and Forkdelta are being worked on. Etherdelta is not responding.

Author: Live Stars
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Dear Live Stars community,  Token distribution is over. Our gratitude to everyone involved. Today, 28.03.2018, we have burned the tokens that were neither sold during our token sale nor included in bounty program pool, Live Stars foundation or developer rewards. As we have mentioned in our previous posts, the final amount of tokens that should be left accessible after all the distribution has ended is 54 722 997. However, as you might know, in November our Parity multisignature wallet (0x94bd4150e41c717b7e7564484693073239715376) was attacked and the funds on it are frozen. The tokens stored on this multisignature account include 14 050 114 LIVE tokens, which are now inaccessible just as Ether on this account is. Those tokens will be burned after the address becomes usable again.  The final amount of tokens that got burned during this event is 131 226 889. This can be verified here: https://etherscan.io/tx/0xfaee06047a79464f95a2b397e83aabbe8a1355086bd8e39f63aff7e8c379d67d

Author: Live Stars
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Dear community,  The time has come to share the latest news with you.  Bounty tokens have been distributed yesterday to all participants who have completed the KYC. Tokens have been sent to the addresses specified in the bounty program spreadsheet.  Beta version functionality is getting wider. Here is the list of latest important updates:  * E-mail confirmation both for users and models. * Password restore functionality for users and models.  * Two-factor authorization * Manual and automatic password restore  * Logging * Model photos, administration functions for photos and albums, photo verification and approval. * Admin and model are now able to ban users from watching by IP.  * Model can ban users by user id. (Banned users can't contact models or watch their broadcast.  * Model tips and earnings statistics.  + started bug-fix process and front-end is being improved.  Token Burn event will take place tomorrow. Tokens will be publicly sent to a non-existent address. This will be verifiable on etherscan.   Exchanges - we have been through verification process by Kucoin, and after we were checked and queued for listing. A month has passed and now we are getting no reply from Kucoin administration. HitBTC have requested 40BTC payment for listing, which we believe is too much. Currently we are reviewing all possible options of a starting listing. Later, with coinmarketcap listing, volume increase and project development we will be aiming for other exchanges, too.

Author: Live Stars
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Dear community,  Most of the time since our token sale has ended, our developers have been busy with development of Live Stars platform and its functionality.  We have received a lot of feedback when we released our alpha version, and now we can say that we moved a lot since that moment, and even now, several weeks before the actual beta release, we can surely say that there's a lot more to test and improve.  Most of end-user side functionality is now completed. We have implemented private messaging (all users, both models and customers, will be able to use our convenient private chat to communicate privately. Chat can not be spied even from Live Stars administration), giving and receiving tips. First prototype of our admin panel is also ready and now our platform is easily moderated. This will make the place safer for all users. Streaming now works flawlessly.  Now when everything mentioned above is completed, we are moving on to creation of model-side interface, their dashboard and streaming panel. Models are an essential part of our platform and their work should be as convenient as possible.  Beta release is scheduled for end of april 2018. We will keep you updated.  Listing is still expected in March. We would like to point out that the exchanges are extremely overloaded  and sometimes we have to wait for an answer up to weeks. The absence of a specific listing date is due to slow actions on the side of the exchanges. We will immediately make the announcement as soon as the listing is in place and we are doing everything that is necessary to resolve these issues.  Best regards, Live Stars team

Author: Live Stars
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Dear community!  We would like to tell you about things happening here in Live Stars over the last few days.  Regarding the development of the Beta release, currently we have made several improvements and continue to work hard on it. Streaming now works through media server which will allows unlimited users connect to the stream without any loss in quality. Stream was tested for 24 hours and it works wihtout any breaks. Now model can see how many users are online and has the possibility to reply to user, ban and ignore him, see token balance, send tips functionality and etc. Now we are going to develop private messaging system which will have a facebook-like interface. All in all there are lots of new functions and they are constantly being updated and optimised.  Meanwhile, work on the legal side is done in partnership with our legal collegues in order to register Live Stars business and get all the necessary licences and preparation for future legal business in several jurisdictions is ongoing.   One more great thing is that we have distributed referral rewards to the Ethereum addresses saved in the participant panel. Everyone should have received them by now.  Bounty rewards will be distributed after the KYC procedure ends for all participants. The last but not least important thing we want to remind you is that the token burn event will happen after bounty distribution.  Stay tuned for more updates.

Author: Live Stars
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Hello,  In the very beginning, we were planning to emit 200 000 000 tokens. 2% of this amount (4 000 000) was supposed to be used as a bounty reward pool. With further development of our project, we decided to make the overall amount of tokens to 79 928 407. The hard cap was not reached, so 2% is calculated from the amount that was actually emitted (54 722 997) not counting unsold tokens, as those will be burned. Bounty pool became 1 094 459 tokens, 2% of the overall amount. Nothing was cut down, just pure calculation. The amount of funds raised during the token sale is 4 times less than we planned at the beginning, and so is the bounty reward pool, as it is calculated according to the actually emitted amount.  Please understand correctly, that only 2% of the overall amount is for bounty. We cannot provide you more, as we have agreements with both token sale contributors and referrers, too. Can i use my father's details? Our utility bill is not named to me, it's named my father's. Please reply so i will know.  You will complete verification if identity will match with address data document. You can not use 2 different person's data. Verification is carried by KYC provider and Live Stars team do not have access to uploaded personal data. Author: Live Stars
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: KYC announcement to Bounty and large amount participants   Dear participants of Live Stars Bounty Campaign and $10k+ contributors! According to Live Stars AML (Anti-Money Laundering) policy, our token holders have to pass the KYC procedure. Users are asked to provide their identity documents and contact details. Who has to pass the KYC? Bounty program participants. Token sale contributors of amounts equivalent 10,000 USD or more at the moment of transaction.  How to pass it? For contributors: KYC is passed through Live Stars contribution panel. You should login on livestars.io, then click on “START KYC” button to start the KYC process. You will have to provide your contact details and upload a scanned copy of an identity document and a utility bill. For bounty participants: KYC is passed through Live Stars contribution panel. You should login on livestars.io. Please specify the SAME ethereum address you specified in the bounty spreadsheet. Then click on “START KYC” button to start the KYC process. You will have to provide your contact details and upload a scanned copy of an identity document and a utility bill. If you do not see the “START KYC” button, check if you specified SAME ethereum address in the livestars.io panel settings.  Is it secure? Yes, KYC is done by a trusted provider, Sum&Substance. You may also check our privacy policy: https://livestars.io/privacy_policy.pdf How long will it last? KYC process will be available for passing for 30 days, until 23rd of March. If you have any questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via our Telegram chat https://t.me/livestarsio.  Requirements for documents:  QUALITY  – All sides of the document should be seen in the photo. – The document should take over 50% or more of the frame. – The picture should be clear, without blur and glare. – Use good light with no shapes. – Photo size must have more or 1MP, the size of scanned copies – more or 150 dpi. – It is ok both Color and black-and-white. – Do not open an image with any graphics editors, because it may be considered as a fraudulent act.   DOCUMENTS  I. Proof of Identity  You can send us these type of documents scanned or photographed from both sides:  – International Passport, – Driver license, – ID card.  II. Proof of address  It can be: Utility Bill, Bank statement, Tax invoices, Other government issued residential statements/certificates.  Thank you for your attention.

Author: Procrustes
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: I had ED in the back of my mind as a start place, for the same reason you evince  ED has a reputation as a place to dump tokens or pick up cheap tokens, depending on whether you are vendor or buyer.  I was thinking more in terms of more mainstream exchanges  While I like ED, it takes some experience to navigate effectively and the first few trades can be unnerving.  Another issue -when a token is experiencing high volume trading, I found the buy and sell spread column unrepresentative and transaction really slow. This is stressful, even with experience.  As an ERC20 token, noobs need to understand the concept of gas/gwei (I think this construct could have used simpler terminology like "package size" and "speed of delivery") AND manually configure gwei (speed) before making any wallet transfers  No knowledge of this is necessary for many larger exchanges (as it is computed automatically). That translates to a larger market.  Anyway, the  main issue is whether there is some plan to list this to boost the market of buyers (with a view to consumption in the platform itself)

Author: Procrustes
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Really brief summary for noobs  Beta platform commences in April and final release in Q3-4 CY18  If all sold, total LIVE tokens = 79 928 407  28% go to the team and foundation, 2% went to bounty hunters  leaving 10% (presale) and 60% (crowdsale) raised from sales  sale started 15.01.18 (about 5-6 days ago)  currently 54% of hardcap met (HC=5M USD)  3 days left of 30% discount  current price is 0.14 USD (ie 14 cents) per LIVE  Sale ends 14.02.18  Unsold coins will all be burned

Author: Procrustes
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: So if no more are sold as of now, total number of tokens will be around 43.16M  Amount raised so far is about 2.73M USD (or 1836 ETH)  By my calculation, token valuation for retail buyers is (0.7)(43.16)/(2.73) or 0.1107 USD (ie about 11 cents)  The valuation takes into account the tokens set aside for developers/marketing/legal etc (30% of the total number of tokens)  tokens are for sale at slightly higher premium to this calculation  this is still good value, given the discount of 30%  the undiscounted sale price in three days from now should be 0.18 USD (ie about 18 cents)  in the long term, ie at the end of 2018, I expect the *valuation* to be at least 20 cents, because there will be a product in beta form. (Actual trading price should be higher, assuming no dumping)  next year, if the product works well, then we can expect consumers of other competing services to migrate to livestars and this will raise the price of LIVE commensurate to its popularity.

Author: Procrustes
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: I hope the coins will trade for above 1 USD within 2 years of beta  Beta development is in April and final release in Q3-4 CY18  I've now had a look at the basic numbers and you can read then here if you are unfamiliar.  Total number of LIVE tokens possible = 79 928 407  Of which, 28% go to the team and foundation, 10% presale, 60% crowdsale and the last 2% bounty.  So, if all tokens were sold, we can say 72% went to the public, which is 57 548 453  At the moment, 53% of the crowdsale target is met, but I am unsure if this includes the whitelist, which I assume is presale.  Assuming it is crowdsale only, then just 31.8% of tokens remain for sale overall. It seems likely that at least half of this amount should be sold before 14.02.18  But if we are conservative and say just another 5% are sold, then we can say the total number of tokens will be 61 385 017  Now if all were sold, we would want to know roughly what the market cap would be at open. Hardcap is 5M from the token sale, which I assume to include presale and crowdsale, i.e. 70%  Since the 70% is the 5M raised, then we can expect dilution by the remaining 30%, so approximately (0.7)(5000000), i.e. $3,500,000 is  perhaps a more truthful initial market cap.  If you want to look at it in terms of strictly the full number of tokens achievable by hardcap, then that is 5000000/79928407, i.e. 0.063USD per LIVE  If we are generous and see the price per token purely in terms of the crowd sale and presale (i.e. 70%), then we should consider 5000000/55949884.9, i.e. 0.089 per LIVE  Worst case, we can then divide the number of tokens at the fully diluted level to give us our bottomline, which is if all tokens are sold, then crowdsale tokens are worth 3500000/79928407 i.e. about .044, assuming all of the team and foundation tokens are dumped on release. Of course they will not, but it does give the prospective buyer some basic idea of the matter at hand, for the worst case scenario.  My guess is the team and foundation will wait until there is some rise in the token value before selling. The foundation has slated the 14% for marketing, software development and legal issues. The team will naturally want to see token value rise for several reasons before they sell much. We can expect the marketing to kick in and a big lift off the bottom before significant developer dumps, provided the team is cohesive.  If less than the full 60% crowdsale is sold, then the effect of dumping by team or foundation will be greater.  Please think about these numbers as only some sketches and thoughts, nothing more. To me, the value of these tokens will rise from the price at release because this sort of product has a natural and large market provided the product works well, i.e. the interaction is good in all technical respects and does not interfere with the human interaction, which is then the next most important aspect.  It could expand more into types of interaction, e.g. strip poker, online pole dancing. This is a niche product as it stands. That is a strength going in, as it means the project can get off the ground in 2018.

Author: lordcameltoe
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Most of what is written in the white paper makes no sense.  The major problems that cam companies face aren't anonymity, processing fees or too many user registrations.  It is traffic.  A cam site needs LOTS of traffic to make things work.  Without constant traffic, the girls won't stay.  Without girls, no traffic comes to the site.  You need to have both at the same time to make things work.  And if you think that simply having an adult site means traffic will magically appear, you are gravely mistaken.  It takes millions, TENS OF MILLIONS of dollars invested into acquiring traffic to get the ball rolling.  Then there is the question of getting good cam models to keep the site busy for when those visitors do eventually show up.  Sure, you can use cam girl studios in Eastern European and Latin American countries to populate the site. But you'll still need some good deals to attract the A-grade models.  And NO. Affiliates will not be the ones to generate that traffic.  If the site isn't attracting users and the girls aren't good enough to make sales, the affiliates will quickly stop promoting the site.  The only way I see this project working is if they are partnered with a leader in the cam business already who will guide them through the process or if they are associated with one of the 5 major players when it comes to adult traffic.

Author: lordcameltoe
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Also, for those that think a higher revshare for the models will make them switch. You're wrong.  Many sites have tried it.  Some even trying to give 100% rev share to the models.  Do you know why they didn't work?  Because without enough revenue going to the company, they couldn't maintain the traffic levels needed to keep the models busy enough to keep streaming on their sites.  The reason why cam companies keep such a big chunk of the revenue is they have VERY high overhead costs when it comes to marketing.  Models will go where there is money to be made.  If they're split of 25% on one site nets them $1,000 a day while their 80% split on another site only makes them $200 a day, where do you think they will keep working?

Author: Procrustes
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: No  Here's how you do it.  Go to a fiat gateway and buy ETH on an exchange. Send the ETH to your private wallet. If you are paranoid, send it again to another wallet. Then buy LIVE. You can do that now at 50% discount.  Then you can spend it directly yourself on the platform, or sell it to someone who want it.  If you are a model, you will receive LIVE. You will then need to convert it to your crypto of choice, before conversion into fiat. In some jurisdictions, this is unnecessary, eg Singapore, as Monaco allows direct loading of crypto onto plastic debit card which can then be used exactly as plastic is now.  Monaco is limited at present (basically really new), but you can see things should progress in one year.  Alternatively, LIVE can be sold and converted into ETH or other major crypto and then turned into fiat. If worried about the trail, it is very simple to create a diversionary intermediate wallet and daisy chain. This only matters if use of livestars platform is illegal in your nation or state, or you are worried about the effect on your social life if caught.  For most people, I don't think it matters.

Body: Maybe I am wrong, but I don't see how.  Let's say I am a young male itching for female contact. The contexts this occurs in are endless.  I send fiat to an exchange. This usually means identity confirmation. OK. I have to wait. So, if I want immediate female interaction, I am stuck with the delay. Currently, this is quite unreliable. It could mean lots of lost business for a platform like this.  Assume it isn't a problem. Let's say I have my fiat on an exchange and I just bought some ETH. It is really easy to move this across wallets if you wish to hide your identity, because LIVE is an ERC20 token. So, you can daisy chain a few or more ETH wallets to your trading wallet to buy LIVE.  If you are a model, you can do just the same thing in reverse and nobody will know.  If you take other precautions, eg about your IP, even your MAC address if you are that paranoid, it should not matter.  For most people it doesn't matter.

Author: paycum2
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: True, i agree deleting the middleman is always a good thing. But on the infographic i can see they ask for a 20% commission. Thats not cutting out the middleman, thats putting yourself as a middleman. I hope i see this percentage wrong, but that is what i read in the infographic.  Also delays in payments arent a "huge" thing in nowadays adult market. Customer deposits are instant 99% of the time. But indeed the payouts to the models normally have a waiting period due to chargebacks and stuff like that, so that indeed is a small improvement.  But although there are a few good things, the question you should ask yourself: will normal customers a) know how to buy bitcoin in the first place, b) know how to send that to an exchange and c) know how to convert those into livestar coins. Well i can tell you, 99% of all normal people wont do this ever. And even if they know how to do that, it will cost way more time then just depositing with your creditcard.  And again im not saying this to be negative, but i know the adult market, customers are most of the time horny - which means they dont have any patience - and those people are already leaving a site if they even hear the word "crypto" or "bitcoin". It will take decades before the mass will use things like this. And yes offcourse new ideas/tech is always good, and someone has to try, but still... there is a long long way to go

Author: paycum2
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Looks promising but im worried a bit about the "revolutionizing" part. Webcam platforms like this have been around for ages, and are about to become obsolete. There are already thousands of websites who use tokens to tip performers, the only difference is that they dont use crypto. I do see potential in the performers revenue (although yours is still incredible huge), but not in the platform itself. A simple webcam site isnt much of a revolution..  You mention "no third party involved", but if customers want to tip models they have to buy your coins right? To buy your coins they have to buy btc and you need a third party for that. If you have your own system and if you want people to buy coins with creditcard or whatever you can not go around a third party. Can you please explain this a bit more, maybe i dont understand it correctlyy.  Also when i look at the team i cant find any info of experiences in the adult industry besides cammodel littleroxie. Do you have any connections in this industry? For me this is important to know as the adult industry isnt like any other industry...

Author: Rigorous
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: It is possible to do anonymous transactions with cryptocurrencies. By that I mean if you buy your Bitcoin or Ethereum online your creditcard bill will show that you transferred x amount of to a cryptocurrency exchange, not that you have been on a webcam website. Live Stars tokens will probably be traded on decentralized exchanges that do not require you to sign up and identify yourself. However, keep in mind while anonymous in many cases crypto transactions can be traced.  The "no third party involved" refers to the smart contract, which allows a customer to transfer Live Stars tokens directly to the performer.

Author: Korsakopf
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment

Author: crevbi
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Live Stars token sale security guide for the participants  Key Points Be careful to avoid scams Token sale begins on January 15 Detailed participation instruction is here — Click to read Do not trust information that you receive in a private message. All announcements will be public. Double-check the website URL before copying the address — https://livestars.io  Be Cautious, Do Not Fall Victim to Scammers We would like to warn potential purchasers to be extremely cautious because most likely there will be several groups attempting to steal your funds by impersonating the Live Stars team, creating fake clone websites and by employing various phishing strategies. Please bookmark our official website — https://livestars.io, Twitter, Facebook, Telegram and Medium Blog(ssilka) so that you would be able to verify all the information there as well. The Live Stars team will never try to obtain your personal information via private messages or email. Smart contract address will be available only in the investor panel on our official website — https://livestars.io  Registration Advice You should use the Chrome browser when going through the registration and purchasing processes. You can add EtherAddressLookup extension to the browser that you use in order to spot the phishing websites  Sale details You have to use a compatible wallet that supports ERC20 tokens in order to participate in the token distribution. If you send ETH to the LIVE Token Distribution Contract from an exchange account, your LIVE Tokens will be allocated to the exchange’s ETH account, and you may never receive or be able to recover your LIVE Tokens. To send ETH, you should use your own personal ETH account that you control.  https://medium.com/live-stars/key-points-741fd1b06dfc

Platform will be worldwide however mostly models will be from Ukraine,Russia,Colombia, USA, Romania, Hungary, Moldova and others.  Quote from: denbodso on January 09, 2018, 08:44:03 PM Hello. I have a concern about anonymity. While you can hide who moves what to whom within using your token, wouldn't exchanges know who buys and who sells it anyway? If a person buys LIVE regularly and never sells it, we can assume that's is a client. A person sells it regularly without ever buying it, that's most likely a model. Quote from: denbodso on January 09, 2018, 09:36:27 PM Quote from: Bolovich on January 09, 2018, 09:26:27 PM It is not so easy to know who is the person on the other side of the transfer. It's much anonymous than paying through a bank, so I'm not worried about it. Once again, the ethereum blockchain contains transaction between you and the livestars. If you are a model and use a non-anonymous exchange (most likely), your identity can still leak. Prove me wrong, please. If a person buys LIVE regularly and never sells it, we can also assume that's is a holder Customer anonymity means for us that no personal data is stored in the platform database. You're right about the fact that transactions are saved and can be seen by anyone, however you cannot connect them to the actual customer of platform. You also can't know what is it model and the customer discuss, and any personal things that may have been told to a model by customer. At the moment, when using a traditional webcam platform, platform saves traces of all their steps, including credit card numbers, names and other parameters. This information is freely passed between platform staff and may get compromised and used afterwards. Fraud and blackmailing in webcam is now not a rare occasion. This is described in our whitepaper. Speaking of models, they will have to verify their identity and age using an ID document. Current adult-business-related laws do not allow to skip this step.   Quote from: ImGenius on January 09, 2018, 11:46:30 PM If the ico starts on january 15, how long it will run?  I cant see details about it in the website. ICO will last for 30 days or finish earlier in case hard cap is reached.  Quote from: stprp on January 10, 2018, 12:23:35 AM How about a Livestars App for Android and iOS ?  Currently, the website is adaptive and you can use it using your mobile device browser. We are going to develop mobile apps both for models and users after we release the platform.  Quote from: Lafftar on January 10, 2018, 04:03:36 AM I think it's going to be completely impossible to go mass market if people can't process payments through traditional payment channels like credit, debit and PayPal. How do you plan on tackling this problem? Of course there's a market of consumers who understand block chain tech, but it's not as big of a market as you could get.  Platform will be convenient for people unfamiliar with cryptocurrencies, as we will provide opportunity to buy tokens with fiat money as well. They will be able to get token in several clicks and they will be able get help from support staff. We will cooperate with traditional payment processors as well so LIVE token will be bought using fiat money. Body: Whitelist participation guide  Whitelist smart contract will be active starting from 14.01. 07:00 AM UTC + 0 time and will end 15.01. 07:00 AM UTC + 0 time. Smart contract address will be available only in the investor panel on our website, so please register there in order to participate.  You have to deposit from the ETH address that you used when filling the form for the whitelist. You will have to enter it in the investor panel in order to see the smart contract address. LIVE tokens will be sent immediately to your Ethereum wallet.  Do not send ETH from an exchange. We recommend using MyEtherWallet for participation.  If you wish to invest with BTC, then you should enter your Ethereum address as well, so we know where to send your purchased LIVE tokens. The provided Bitcoin address is valid only for one transaction. If you wish to make another transaction, click on “Request a new address” button. Body: Interesting project. But I have one question.  So there is 5 000 000$ hard cap in token sell and coins are 0.20$ a piece? So total coin cap would be 25 million tokens? However white paper says "During the token sale, 120 million LIVE will be available for purchasing." So that makes me little bit confusing? Also during first sale, tokes where only 5 cent a piece. (1 million hard cap, so 20 million tokens in the market right now?). I feel this makes 20 cent tokens really expensive.  What happens when market opens and those 20 million coin owners want to cash out their 300% gains? Specially if there is 5 million hard cap and only 25 million coins are sold in second phase. Then half of the coins are 5 cent ones.  Project is great, but I'm not sure if I should buy tokens with 20cent a piece.  So which numbers are wrong in whitepaper? (I hope it's 0.2$)  "The token sale (January 2017 - February 2017). During the token sale, 120 million LIVE will be available for purchasing. Soft Cap - $ 500,000 Hard Cap - $ 5,000,000 Cost of 1 LIVE = $0.20"

Author: Gambit_fr
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: I've had the same question when translating the whitepaper and thought it was a mistake. But I've got an answer from the team and it is not. Originally their hardcap was $24,000,000 hence the 120 million tokens created. Now they have changed their hardcap to $5,000,000 so when they'll reached it the remaining tokens will be burned. During the Pre-ICO, they did not reach their hardcap, I don't remember exactly how much tokens were emitted but it is between 5 and 10 million. In my opinion, for real profits, you'll have to wait until end of 2018 when the project will be released, until then it would only be small speculation.

Author: Wigi
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Oh OK.. But then it will be probably better to just buy tokens from the open market. Half of the tokens where bought from 5 cents so those probably sell cheaper than 20 cent a piece. 20 million tokens where sold at 5 cent a piece and 25 million at 20 cent a piece. That will make average price per token to be 13,3 cents. well that would be 166% gain for those that bought at 5cents, but over 33.5% loss for those that would buy for 20 cent a piece. I have seen so many ICO's that tanks their token price in open market. When half of the tokens are sold 75% cheaper it makes it really risky to invest. If they don't sell all those 25 million tokens then this situation is even worse.  Company is worth 6 million based on token sell, still tokens are valuated as 9 million (with 20cents a piece). if tokens would be shares they would be overpriced, however everything with crypto coins are nowadays over priced, so it might not matter after all.  We can expect that coins will have good volumes, if site has enough users. Every coin that customers buy and use will be dumped back to market by models. That might make coin price more stable. (It acts more like a currency and not like a stock.)  Other things that people should consider. This is one platform and one site like livejasmin. It's not like ethereum where people can build hundred of business to drive coin price up. Site needs probably 100 000 users who all uses at least 90$ a year to be worth 9 million and that's total sales (most of the money goes for models.). However coin circulation has to be lot higher to justify 20cent price. If only half of the coins are used before models dump them back to the market, then coin prices goes down. I can't really say if coins are worth 20cent a piece. There are multiple factors that might or might not effect the price. Like will models get their payment everyday, once a week or once a month. (how frequently they will dump the coins.)Or how many buying users site has? I'm not financial advisor, but there sure are risks. Sure coins might be worth even more than 20 cents! No one really knows for sure.  I hate the idea where company just moves all the risks to investors. After coin sell they just burn all the coins, so after that coin price doesn't matter to them. They take their revenue from models and their coins will always be with market price. So there are no risks. I start to think that cryptos are perfect way to make a company with other peoples money. You own your company and you don't need to share your revenues. All those investors just have some tokens that might have some random value. if they end up to be worthless it's was just investors money that went to drains.

Author: Live Stars
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Hello, There is a lot of work to be, including development of the platform side functionality, testing of a payment system, security audits, legal work and of course marketing for the working platform.  Quote from: CryptoCutie on December 21, 2017, 04:58:33 AM No min payout sound and no waiting time sounds nice for the models, but will LIVE STARS also pay the models in fiat how the other cam sites? We have covered all these questions in our whitepaper https://livestars.io/whitepaper.pdf  Quote from: PS92 on December 21, 2017, 01:46:48 AM How do you guys compare to a project like SpankChain? Quote from: batako on December 21, 2017, 12:26:09 AM Quote from: Zarbout on December 20, 2017, 09:32:44 PM Hi. What's your soft/hard cap? what will be token price in the ICO?  I didn't find such informations on the website. All I know is the crowdsale will be started at 15 January 2018. I wish they will add the complete infos on the site soon!  We have covered these questions on our website in FAQ https://livestars.io/faq  and also in our whitepaper. Our hard cap is $5,000,000 , soft cap - $500,000.  Quote from: PS92 on December 21, 2017, 01:46:48 AM Quote from: ronin07 on December 20, 2017, 03:37:43 PM Quote from: PS92 on December 20, 2017, 02:46:25 PM Quote from: pynetx on December 19, 2017, 05:39:46 AM What is it that you have and chatburate doesn't except being decentralized?  I think the reward model in Chaturbate is most likely skewed very much to the developerside: viewers pay more and models receive less. In Live Stars the smart contracts will take care of all the backend stuff, meaning there's more of the pie to share: cheaper to watch, more to earn.  Correct me if I'm wrong! Webcam projects that exist have very big problems in terms of anonymity, and payments to models. LIVE STARS solves all these problems with the help of the blockchain, the models will earn more and get their money faster and the perverted users will be completely anonymous. If they populate this project to them all models and users will switch from other platforms their token will be the local currency that will be used demand and growth in price. Plus, if they make an online toy store for models for tokens or in general sex shops for tokens, then this is the origin of the sex industry on the blockchain.    How do you guys compare to a project like SpankChain?  Live Stars and SpankChain work in the same field of webcam industry, however, spankChain have a different business model. Their sold token, SPANK, is used similarly to generate another token, that can be used by models and businesses to pay fee for access to SpankChain platform and marketplace. By the way, their token sale has already ended.  Our business model implies using our token, LIVE, as an only mean of payment between customers and models on Live Stars platform, which would allow full control of funds for both models and users of the platform. You may find the detailed description of this and how it solves industry issues in our whitepaper - https://livestars.io/whitepaper.pdf

Author: Live Stars
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Hello,  Speaking of code currently available on our GitHub, which is the code of LIVE token and token presale contracts - we are going to verify the contract source code on etherscan, so it will be available publicly. When it comes to release of our platform, we will allow public tests and perform an independent source code audit before launch. Users will also be able to check out the front-end application code in order to see the information that is being sent out.  Quote from: MaxMidnite on December 11, 2017, 02:29:17 PM Hi all,  I'm new investor and sorry if this has been asked before.  What is the difference between: https://medium.com/spankchain and Live Stars.  I have done my research into the webcam industry and ready to invest, but I seen a few similar clones.  I need to be certain to invest in SpankChain or give Live Stars a chance.  Serious reply would be appreciated, I know these boards are full of teenagers and scammers.  Cheers..  Hello,  Live Stars and SpankChain work in the same field of webcam industry, however, spankChain have a different business model. Their sold token, SPANK, is used similarly to generate another token, that can be used by models and businesses to pay fee for access to SpankChain platform and marketplace. By the way, their token sale has already ended.  Our business model implies using our token, LIVE, as an only mean of payment between customers and models on Live Stars platform, which would allow full control of funds for both models and users of the platform. You may find the detailed description of this and how it solves industry issues in our whitepaper - https://livestars.io/whitepaper.pdf

Author: Live Stars
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Dear Live Stars community!  Yesterday, it came to our knowledge that Parity multi-signature wallet library contract was wiped out from Ethereum blockchain, leading to all multi-signature wallets becoming unusable. You can find Parity statement on this here: https://paritytech.io/blog/security-alert.html  Unfortunately, Live Stars team has been one of the affected. We have been using such multi-signature wallet to store all funds that have been raised during presale. We are currently unable to access the funds, and its entire remaining balance - 671.69 ETH is blocked. We are currently looking for a solution and expecting action from Parity Technologies concerning this accident. We hope that this issue will somehow be resolved soon.  Funds have been partly taken out of the wallet before, and we will continue working on Live Stars project and move on to our next big goals - alpha version release and token sale. However, our resources are now greatly reduced.  We will release an update concerning our future plans shortly.  Kind regards, Live Stars team

Author: Live Stars
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Dear Live Stars community! We’ve been through a lot this week, and now, again, it’s time to share the results with you. First of all, thanks to everyone involved, we’ve completed our token presale, and it has definitely been a success — 1043.84 ETH raised from 649 participants. We’re now moving towards our next big goal —token sale. A lot of work has already been done, but there’s more to come. Live Stars platform is in development, and its’ alpha is going to be ready before the token sale. Main page design is almost ready now. We decided to use light colors so that content attracts more attention. Speaking of design, our landing page and ANN thread are getting a new one, too. We’ve received a lot of feedback, and many decisions we’ve taken at the beginning have been reconsidered. Therefore, we’re going to present an updated version of our whitepaper next week. We’re planning to start main token sale round on 30th of November. All tokens unsold during token presale are going to be sold on token sale. All tokens unsold during token sale are going to be burned.

Author: Live Stars
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Dear Live Stars community!  Yesterday, we had a meeting, which took longer than we expected. We came to a conclusion, that we have sufficient resources in order to make Live Stars much better than it is now. We have decided to add several important features to our alpha version, update our landing, make it possible to contribute to our token sale using several cryptocurrencies and make sure everything runs as smoothly as it did on presale.  Taking all feedback we received into account, we decided to reconsider our future plans and timetable.  First of all, we are moving our token sale starting date to 15th of January. We know this is quite a delay, however we believe it will be much better for Live Stars and everyone involved in our progress. Extra time will provide us an opportunity to prepare much more material, widen our marketing plan and perform an independent security audit.  Secondly, we decided that all tokens not sold during our token sale will be burned using a smart contract. Developer rewards will be calculated accordingly - 14% of the amount sold. This will ensure that participants receive a larger part of LIVE tokens. This will be included in an updated version of our whitepaper.  Thirdly, we are going to participate in Blockchain & Bitcoin Conference Moscow (https://moscow.blockchainconf.world), which will take place on 15-16 November. Hope to meet you there!  Stay tuned on our project news, there's a lot more to come!  Kind regards,  Live Stars team

Author: Rigorous
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: The other day I watched a documentary about the Ashley Madison data breach. It is a dating website for people already in a relationship. In 2016 they had 46 million users. Members could pay a fee to have their profile deleted.  When the website was hacked it turned out the data was never permanently removed. Furthermore 95% of the members were male and there were over 70,000 so called `fembots` sending fake messages, reusing the personal data of closed female accounts including those on other sites related only by their parent company.  That shows there is a huge market for the intersection of anonymity, security of personal data and textual relationships with women. Live Stars could have a point there.

Author: Live Stars
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: The model will be able to exchange any amount of tokens using the third party payment service which our company will have a contract with. That can be done in several clicks. Currently models have to complete much more complicated things, such as setting up their computer for live broadcasts, setting additional plugins for better quality broadcast, registering and linking to platform e-wallets such as Payoneer to receive their payments. We believe that switching to cryptocurrency will make this process less complicated than it is now. There will be friendly video guides for models as well as for members.  Quote from: kraterion on September 22, 2017, 08:46:37 PM Regarding collaboration with other blockchains, what do you have in mind? I'm excluding blockchains with anon protocol like zk-SNARKs and CryptoNote built in like ZCash and Monero because eth will have full privacy as well with Byzantium upgrade. Or maybe you're planning to move to another smart contracts platform or do even your own one ? We were planning on implementing some parts of the process using external solutions, those currently include performer identity and age verification. We do not want to disclose names and exact plans in order to avoid future misunderstandings, as there are no signed agreements at the moment to prove the claims.  Quote from: flashbit on September 22, 2017, 08:49:26 PM Quote from: matjas on September 22, 2017, 08:21:20 PM I guess the most convincing reason would be the higher percentage they will earn using this platform. I dont know how is elsewhere, but according to their description, models get only 30-50% of total income but using this platform they will get 70-80%  That's what I wanted to point : for me the main asset of this project is the better income for the models,compared to other platforms.  Did you anticipate some sort of exclusivity ? I mean : what is going to prevent a model to stream for several platforms at once ? it could break your economics forecasts ?  I hope the answer isn't in the 180 posts before... It is pretty common for models to use several platforms at once, we're not going to prevent this. We took that into account when doing initial calculations, and it does not break our forecasts. It is real practice that models use 6-7 sites per stream. Author: Live Stars
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Hello,  At the moment our main goal is to deliver the platform with all its main, essential features. This, unfortunately, does not include additional innovations such as VR integration. We thought about it but LiveJasmin unsuccessful experience proved that it is too way early for VR in webcam. Once we get off the ground, we will look into all possible improvements for our platform, as such small details might be crucial when it is in production. We are definitely planning to integrate with several external blockchain projects during Live Stars development. For an instance, performer identity verification is one of the things that could be implemented using an external secure solution. The same can be said about instant LIVE token exchange for members and performers. At the moment there are no agreements, so we'd prefer not to disclose exact project names in order to avoid future misunderstandings.

Author: Gambit_fr
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: I hope your ICO will be a great success and if you'll be able to launch your platform, I'm sure it will be a great success!  I studied the adult live show market about 10 years ago and my main finding was that performers was highly underpaid (less than 50% of what the customer paid to see them), especially with websites/performers located in East Europe and third-world. I also talked with some performers and they all told me that they would like to be better paid, have better work conditions and more freedom.  I almost tried to launch a live show website by myself, willing to share 75% of the revenue to the performers (and already knew a lot of them, from all over the world, willing to work on a site like that); but it was a lot of work, a lot of hassle with French laws and my girlfriend at that time thought I was willing to become a pimp...  So I give up, sadly for me and the performers I was talking to...  So I hope you will succeed where I failed and will really revolutionize the webcam industry!!!

Author: Live Stars
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Hello,  Thank you for your support! Honestly, it's great to hear from someone who had a similar idea. After working in that field for quite a long time, our team members can tell the same story. We even made a survey across models and viewers, and result weren't particularly surprising - everyone was discontent with the revenue share percentage and the fact that basically every move is controlled by website administration, leaving no privacy at all.  Currently one of our main problems is that crypto-community is mostly unaware of this field of adult industry, so we really appreciate that someone experienced in the field shares their opinion about our project.

Author: Live Stars
Title: [ANN]⭐LIVE STARS ⭐ Revolutionizing Live Adult Entertainment
Body: Hello,  Thank your for your questions. Live Stars is not associated with Shinecoin in any way and our project is a separate entity. We did not take Shinecoin into account when our whitepaper and business model was being developed simply because we were unaware of such project. Our ideas are based on our own experience in this field and knowledge of internal issues. You can tell that by simply comparing our whitepaper and Shinecoin's. They do not have much in common.  Live Stars team does not want to risk contributed funds, so we set a task to create a product that will have the most chances of actually working when it comes to the final release. When defining our task, we came to a conclusion that our product, in order to become popular and actually enter the competition, has to be easily understandable, and the transition from the current offers to our platform should be simple enough for anyone to grasp.  When something is upgraded or improved, users mostly care about the advantages that the improvement provides to them, not about the technology that stands behind. We, as a team of developers, can take advantage of blockchain technology in order to create a product that is better than current analogues in most simple and in-demand terms - we offer higher performer revenue share, security from potential fraud, provable user anonymity - without changing the way it looks to our end-users.  We aim on solving real business issues using blockchain tech.
